intro: Hylomecon japonica var. dissecta, commonly known as the Japanese dissected hylomecon, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers with a distinctive structure, typically blooming in late spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of botanical circles.
